kripke_structure.coerce_set(x: SetInput) → List[str]

Assure the Set type for x.

Note: a coerced set is always sorted. This simplifies the usage of incidence vectors with consistent index positions.

kripke_structure.get_labels_from_state(m: KripkeStructureInput, s: StateInput, output_type: type, TypeVar = typing.List[str]) → AtomicPropertySet

Given a Kripke structure M (m), and a state s ∈ S, return the set of labels (aka atomic properties) attached to that state.

Parameters

  • m – The Kripke structure M

  • s – A state s

kripke_structure.get_logical_not(v: ~nptyping.base_meta_classes.NDArray[~nptyping.base_meta_classes.Shape[*], ~numpy.bool_]) → bool_]

Return the element-wise inverse (or logical not) of a binary vector.

If the binary vector is the incidence vector of a set, this is equivalent to the or set operation: min(IV(s), IV(t)) ≡ s ∩ t

kripke_structure.get_maxima(v1: ~nptyping.base_meta_classes.NDArray[~nptyping.base_meta_classes.Shape[*], ~numpy.bool_], v2: ~nptyping.base_meta_classes.NDArray[~nptyping.base_meta_classes.Shape[*], ~numpy.bool_]) → bool_]

Return the element-wise maxima of a binary vector with regard to another binary vector

If the binary vector is the incidence vector of a set, this is equivalent to the set union operation: max(IV(s), IV(t)) ≡ s ∪ t

kripke_structure.get_minima(v1: ~nptyping.base_meta_classes.NDArray[~nptyping.base_meta_classes.Shape[*], ~numpy.bool_], v2: ~nptyping.base_meta_classes.NDArray[~nptyping.base_meta_classes.Shape[*], ~numpy.bool_]) → bool_]

Return the element-wise minima of a binary vector with regard to another binary vector

If the binary vector is the incidence vector of a set, this is equivalent to the set intersection operation: min(IV(s), IV(t)) ≡ s ∩ t

kripke_structure.get_set(s_prime: SetOrIVInput, s: List[str]) → List[str]

Given a subset S’ ⊆ S or its incidence vector, return the corresponding subset

kripke_structure.get_set_from_range(n: int, prefix: str = 'e', index_start: int = 0)

Generate a set of n elements, prefixed and numbered with 0 padding

kripke_structure.get_states_from_label(m: KripkeStructureInput, s_prime: StateSetInput, label: AtomicPropertyInput, output_type: type, TypeVar = typing.List[str]) → StateSet

Return the states linked to a label

Given a Kripke structure M (m), (conditionally) given a subset S’ of S, given a label (aka atomic property) ∈ AP, return the subset of states S’’ ⊆ S (or S’) that are attached to that label.

Parameters

  • m – The Kripke structure M

  • s_prime – None to exhaustively analyse M, or a subset of S to limit the analysis otherwise.

  • label – The label (aka atomic property) ap

  • output_type – Set or IncidenceVector depending on the desired output

Returns

The subset S’’ ⊆ S

kripke_structure.is_instance(o: object, t: type, TypeVar) → bool

Check if an arbitrary object o is of type or TypeVar t

The native isinstance function does not support parametrized generics. Hence, we need a wrapper function to extend type checking.

Parameters

  • o – Any object

  • t – A type or TypeVar

Returns

A boolean

kripke_structure.sat_a(m: KripkeStructure, s_prime: SetOrIVInput, label: AtomicPropertyInput, output_type: type, TypeVar = typing.List[str]) → SetOrIV

Get the satisfaction set of the state formula Sat(a)

Formally: Let M be an LTS model with states S. Conditional: Let S’ be a subset of S. Let a be a label (aka atomic property). Let L(s) be the set of labels (aka atomic properties) attached to s. Let Sat(a) = {s_i ∈ S’ ⊆ S | a ∈ L(s_i)}

Parameters

  • m – The Kripke structure model M.

  • s_prime – (conditional) The subset S’ ⊆ S. Note that if s_prime is None, it is assumed that all states are considered and NOT no states (the empty set).

  • label – The label (aka atomic property).

  • output_type – (conditional) Set or IncidenceVector. Default equals Set.

Returns

The satisfaction set. If output_format is IncidenceVector, then the returned incidence vector is relative to the set S of the model, and not S’.

kripke_structure.sat_not_phi(m: KripkeStructure, s_prime: SetOrIVInput, sat_phi: SetOrIVInput, output_type: type, TypeVar = typing.List[str]) → SetOrIV

Get the satisfaction set of the state formula Sat(¬Φ)

Formally: Let M be an LTS model with states S. Conditional: Let S’ be a subset of S. Let Φ be a state formula. Lemma: Sat(¬Φ) = S ∖ Sat(Φ). Let Sat(a) = {s_i ∈ S’ ⊆ S | s_i ∉ Sat(Φ)}

Parameters

  • m – The Kripke structure model M.

  • s_prime – (conditional) The subset S’ ⊆ S. Note that if s_prime is None, it is assumed that all states are considered and NOT no states (the empty set).

  • sat_phi – The satisfaction set Sat(Φ).

  • output_type – (conditional) Set or IncidenceVector. Default equals Set.

Returns

The satisfaction set. If output_format is IncidenceVector, then the returned incidence vector is relative to the set S of the model, and not S’.

kripke_structure.sat_phi_and_psi(m: KripkeStructure, s_prime: SetOrIVInput, sat_phi: SetOrIVInput, sat_psi: SetOrIVInput, output_type: type, TypeVar = typing.List[str]) → SetOrIV

Get the satisfaction set of the state formula Sat(Φ ∧ Ψ)

Formally: Let M be a Kripke structure’s model with states S. Conditional: Let S’ be a subset of S. Let Φ be a state formula. Let Ψ be a state formula. Lemma: Sat (Φ ∧ Ψ) = Sat (Φ) ∩ Sat (Ψ). Let Sat(Φ ∨ Ψ) = {s_i ∈ S’ ⊆ S | s_i ∉ {Sat(Φ) ∩ Sat (Ψ)} } Let min(v1, v2) be the element-wise min operation For incidence vectors: min is equivalent to ∩ on sets Hence, Sat(Φ ∨ Ψ) ~ min(IV(Φ), IV(Ψ).

Parameters

  • m – The Kripke structure model M.

  • s_prime – (conditional) The subset S’ ⊆ S. Note that if s_prime is None, it is assumed that all states are considered and NOT no states (the empty set).

  • sat_phi – The satisfaction set Sat(Φ).

  • sat_psi – The satisfaction set Sat(Ψ).

  • output_type – (conditional) Set or IncidenceVector. Default equals Set.

Returns

The satisfaction set. If output_format is IncidenceVector, then the returned incidence vector is relative to the set S of the model, and not S’.

kripke_structure.sat_phi_or_psi(m: KripkeStructure, s_prime: SetOrIVInput, sat_phi: SetOrIVInput, sat_psi: SetOrIVInput, output_type: type, TypeVar = typing.List[str]) → SetOrIV

Get the satisfaction set of the state formula Sat(Φ ∨ Ψ)

Formally: Let M be a Kripke structure’s model with states S. Conditional: Let S’ be a subset of S. Let Φ be a state formula. Let Ψ be a state formula. Lemma: Sat (Φ ∨ Ψ) = Sat (Φ) ∪ Sat (Ψ). Let Sat(Φ ∨ Ψ) = {s_i ∈ S’ ⊆ S | s_i ∉ {Sat(Φ) ∪ Sat (Ψ)} } Let max(v1, v2) be the element-wise max operation For incidence vectors: max is equivalent to ∪ on sets Hence, Sat(Φ ∨ Ψ) ~ max(IV(Φ), IV(Ψ).

Parameters

  • m – The Kripke structure model M.

  • s_prime – (conditional) The subset S’ ⊆ S. Note that if s_prime is None, it is assumed that all states are considered and NOT no states (the empty set).

  • sat_phi – The satisfaction set Sat(Φ).

  • sat_psi – The satisfaction set Sat(Ψ).

  • output_type – (conditional) Set or IncidenceVector. Default equals Set.

Returns

The satisfaction set. If output_format is IncidenceVector, then the returned incidence vector is relative to the set S of the model, and not S’.

kripke_structure.sat_tt(m: KripkeStructure, s_prime: SetOrIVInput = None, output_type: type, TypeVar = typing.List[str]) → SetOrIV

Get the satisfaction set of the state formula Sat(tt)

Formally: Let M be a Kripke Structure model with states S. Conditional: Let S’ be a subset of S. Let tt be the tautological truth state formula. Let Sat(tt) = {s ∈ S’ ⊆ S}.

Parameters

  • m – The Kripke structure model M.

  • s_prime – (conditional) The subset S’ ⊆ S. Note that if s_prime is None, it is assumed that all states are considered and NOT no states (the empty set).

  • output_type – (conditional) Set or IncidenceVector. Default equals Set.

Returns

The satisfaction set. If output_format is IncidenceVector, then the returned incidence vector is relative to the set S of the model, and not S’.
